page.title: 08Footpaths in Morwenstow
page.content: As with most areas Morwenstow has its system of public footpaths which link specific places in the most direct route allowing for the natural lie of the land. Each of the paths has a number, there are 34 in Morwenstow and of these 13 are in the southern part of the parish. One of them No 4, the path from Lee to Shop is an ancient highway and a very enjoyable walk with woodland and high ground sections. Another impressive footpath to walk is No 1 the coastal path which is part of the North Cornwall Coastal path. This path has very steep sections such as at Stanbury mouth but the scenery is magnificent at any time of the year. Footpath No 5 is a beautiful walk from Burridge via Sanctuary to Coombe passing down the lovely Coombe valley. The rich patterns of green and stark greyness make this a special place.
